Description: Polished unpierced emerald bead. Low quality emerald or beryl.
Curator's comments: Poor quality emeralds such as these were mined in the Eastern Desert of Egypt and were particularly popular in fashion of the Late Ptolemaic and Early Roman periods in Egypt. Subsequently they were surpassed by the finer quality examples imported from india.
Xia type GN67/71. Xia, N. 2014, Ancient Egyptian Beads, Heidelberg.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (QJ.12)
